layer.name: Responsibility
layer.definition: If it's in your life, it's yours to address.

questions.text: When I feel angry, sad, or anxious, it's because ...

answers.4: I'm reacting, though some triggers are harder than others
answers.5: that's how I'm responding — the trigger didn't make me
answers.3: there was a trigger, but my response could have been better
answers.1: someone or something made me feel that way

questions.text: Processing and managing my emotions is ...

answers.4: my job, though I don't always do it well
answers.2: easier when I have support to lean on
answers.3: my job, but I need help sometimes
answers.1: hard when no one is there to help me through it

answers.4: mine to change, though the past makes some more difficult
answers.2: shaped by my past in ways that are hard to undo
answers.3: created by my past, I can influence them
answers.1: the result of what I've been through

answers.4: my responsibility, though I don't always prioritize it
answers.2: dependent on having resources and help
answers.3: my responsibility, but I need the right help to get there
answers.1: hard without the right therapist or support system

questions.text: How my emotional expression affects others is ...
questions.principle: Own the impact of your emotions

answers.4: my responsibility, though I don't always catch it in time
answers.2: something I think about, but my feelings are my feelings
answers.3: something I should consider, but I can't always control it
answers.1: not my problem — I can't control how they take it

remediation.advice: Emotional responsibility means admitting: 'No one makes me feel anything — I generate my own emotional responses.' Your history explains your patterns but doesn't excuse them. Taking responsibility for your emotional life is the first step to actually changing it.

scripture.text: Whoever is slow to anger is better than the mighty, and he who rules his spirit than he who takes a city.
